Created an attachment (id=77179)
Eclipse Log when Profiling Big Java Applications 

"A time-out occurred while attempting to launch the process" error message when we profile Java application even if when use filtering and we INCLUDE just one class

Eugene, 
could you tell what is the difference between this use case from use cases in the bug #201443 and bug #201447?
Thanks.

bug 201474: launch without any success, ie. no resource (node/process/agent) is created in profile monitor view, time out error is thrown in UI.
bug 201443: launch with IAC, resources are created, but the actual Java application is never launched and no data is collected, eg nothing shown in Console or Application GUI never show.
bug 201447: launch with RAC, resources are created, Java application is launch (Console output or App GUI shows), but no data is collected still, and terminating the process from profiling monitor view does not work.

All these show unstable and inconsistence result between profile launches.

Thank you, I see.
201443 and 210447 are fixed.
What should be done to reproduce the 201774?
I am not sure if this defect duplicates others.
Thanks.

I personally cannot reproduce the problem and this problem is reported by user on mailing list. By looking at the log file attached by user, it may be related to bug 201439.

Hi Igor,
sorry for writing only now.
I saw in the newsgroup that other people are still seeing this bug, even with the latest 4.4.1 releases. So I decided to verify myself (I know, I had to do before, sorry for this!!). Actually, the new releases do not work yet!

I tried build 200709101254 and the problem is still there.

I made a binary comparison of SocketTL.dll in this release with the one provided in 200709060100 and the differences are minimal, as the only different bytes are:
- 00D8, 00D9, 00DA
- 8E14. 8E15, 8E16
- from 90A1 to 90A6 (which contain the different timestamp of the release)

The modified SockeTL.dll, instead, is very different, but it might be because of the C compiler option used? Might be this the real problem?

I'm attaching the servicelog generated with release 200709101254 of the stand-alone agent controller, with DEBUG level.

Hi Igor!
I did further investigation and, using the new test installation, I created a brand new workspace and imported the "HelloWorld" project into it.
Then I tried to profile using the IAC and... it works!

So, the problems I'm encountering (TPTPController that does not start with the existing installation, configuration error with the new...) must be caused by my old workspace, but I can't understand what could be wrong with it.

If you have any suggestion on this... they are welcome.

However, I hope we can say that the problem described in this bug report is definitely fixed.

Thank you very much for your support and sorry for me not pointing out the actual source of the problems sooner.
Mauro.
